content.description: From AFALCON GUIDE by Eric J. Horst:    "Begin below the arete just left of Nubbin. Start up a crack until you can move left onto the arete. Trend to the left side of the arete toward the top."
content.protection: Standard set of nuts and cams .5 - 2 for leading.   Plenty of trees at the top for TR.

content.description: Start 5 feet downstream (left) of Great Biginnings. Climb the steep wall between Great Beginnings and Nylons and then traverse out to the right side arete to an easier finish.
Start below the overhanging section directly below the Great Beginnings corner.  Climb the small crack angling up and right.  Finish on the face above using small flakes.
content.protection: Trees/Boulders can be used to set up TR.
content.location: Overhang between Great Beginnings and Flaky.  Walk-down downstream of Romeo's Ladder area.

content.description: Start at Zig-Zag edge start. Follow the easy ramp for 35 feet to right facing corner.  Climb corner to overhang and exit right beneath the overhang.   Var - 5.5 Finish by climbing overhang.
Sit start with the two crimps and climb straight up. Top out.
content.location: The Seclusion Boulder is located just off the River Trail, near where you might set up top ropes for many of the Seclusion climbs. The climb is at the center of the boulder, river side.

content.description: Climb through some broken rock down low to the base of the shallow right facing corner. Nice jamming and stemming take you to a steep but juggy top out.
content.protection: While most don't lead at GF, you can certainly do so on this one if you choose. A single set of cams from fingers to blue camalot should work fine, maybe some medium to large nuts as well. A TR can easily be set from some nice trees back from the cliff edge.
content.location: One of the easier routes to find from the top, as it has a very distinct finishing flake. From below it's the obvious right facing shallow corner system that's right of Great Beginnings and left of Seclusion.

content.description: Start ten feet downstream and below the ledge from Stan's Lead. Climb the arete to right of Sickle face and left of Stan's Lead.

Start on the boulder like section just to the right of the large right facing corner that is Snowflake.  Boulder up through the lower section aiming for the blanker face to the right of Snowflake.  Move up to a sickle faced flake then on to a few very thin moves to a small ledge.  Mantle the ledge and continue straight up the face on better holds.
content.location: Starts just to the right of Snowflake down low on some bouldery blocks.  It's on the face between the Snowflake corner and prominent arete.

content.description:
Seclusion 5.7 climb crack in the lower left of the face for 15 feet then step right and climb the flaring crack to the end.  

  --Variation 5.8 climb the face to the right of the flaring crack.   --Variation 5.10- climb the face to the left of the flaring crack.
content.protection: Boulders and trees abound for top rope anchors.  If you wish to set a directional above the 5.10- variation there are two pockets which accept brown and pink tricams respectively.
content.location: Seclusion and Sickle's Edge prow are visible from the River Trail after the Juliet's Balcony area.  Seclusion is the closest upriver facing climb (directly in front of the distinctive prow as seen from the trail) split by a flaring crack.

content.description: Start halfway up the dihedral left of Nubbin at the base of a shallow crack in the upstream facing wall. Climb the crack.
content.protection: Natural anchors at top for TR

content.description: Ascend right facing flake and bulging wall to an easy finish
Start around the corner, 30 feet downstream from seclusion, on the wall facing the river - go up the easy face.
content.location: 30 feet downstream from Seclusion, around corner.

content.description: Start on the right (when facing the boulder from the river) on the large holds. Follow the large holds/cracks up and top out.
content.location: The Seclusion Boulder is located just off the River Trail, near where you might set up top ropes for many of the Seclusion climbs. The climb is at on the far right when facing from the river.

content.description: Start up some easy rock to the base of the left to right trending crack/flake system. Some cruxy moves on small feet take you to easier climbing up the corner. A direct variation is possible up the steep, chalked up seam that leads into the same corner.
content.protection: Easy to rig as a TR. If you lead it, take a single set from fingers to 4 camalot, and some nuts.
content.location: Another one that's easy to find from the top of the cliff. Look for the obvious gully at the top that splits the cliff in two. From below look for the left to right trending flake that leads to a big right facing corner.

content.description: Starts below a right facing corner on a large triangular slab.  Work your way basically straight up to the corner where a prominent diagonal flake and a small bulge/roof meet.  Go up the right side of the diagonal flake over the bulge or traverse across bulge/roof and then go up.  The latter works better if your top rope is set up on Snowflake.
content.location: Towards the center of the Seclusion area between Great Beginnings (on the left) and Snowflake (on the right).

content.description: Start on the far left (when facing the boulder from the river) on the large cracks. Follow the cracks up and top out.
content.location: The Seclusion Boulder is located just off the River Trail, near where you might set up top ropes for many of the Seclusion climbs. The climb is at on the far left when facing from the river.

content.description: Start at top of face just upstream from Seclusion - descend a zig-zagging route down the face
The Seclusion Area has a nice mix of easy and moderate climbs. It is good for beginners and groups and is often used by classes. It is located about 75 yards downstream from Juliet's Balcony.
